hypothesis: Neuroplasticity (domain-seeding) co-occurs with principle CREATION, not just P-mention
method: Extracted P-creation sessions (SESSION-LOG +NP>0, n=38) and domain-seeding sessions (git diff-filter=A domains/*/DOMAIN.md, n=17) from full history (181 sessions). Computed co-occurrence lift at windows 0-3.
verdict: PARTIAL: narrowing from P-mention to P-creation reduces lift from 3.66x to 1.40x (window=0). Domain seeding co-occurs with P-rich contexts (mention) but not proportionally with P-creation. The neuroplasticityâ†”principle-extraction isomorphism is weaker than S326 suggested.
interpretation: S326's 3.66x measured domain-seeding sessions as P-discussion-rich contexts, not as P-creation triggers. The causal link (domain novelty triggers principle formation) is weaker (1.4x) than the contextual association (3.66x). F-BRN6 downgrades from CONFIRMED to PARTIAL.
caveat: Small n (17 domain-seed sessions). P-creation detection via SESSION-LOG may miss principles created but not logged in the same session. Domain seeding detection via DOMAIN.md file creation misses informal seeding.
